Use up and down to set how much you earn an hour. Then select to start or pause the ticking. The app will display how much you have earned. To reset the earnings to 0 hold select.

changelog.release_notes:
Initial 1.0 Release

Features include:

- Timer can be set with minutes and seconds/reset/cancelled
- Screen animates to show progress

data.description:
A simple app for a simple missing feature. This allows you to set a timer for up to an hour and have it vibrate the watch when it is done. I personally use it for when I'm brewing coffee.

Controls are:
Up/Down(long or short): Change value
Select(short): Change from minutes and seconds
Select(long): Start timer
Select(short while timer is active): Cancels timer

latest_release.release_notes:
Initial 1.0 Release

Features include:

- Timer can be set with minutes and seconds/reset/cancelled
- Screen animates to show progress
- Watch will vibrate when complete

changelog.release_notes:
**Make sure to update SimonRemote on your Mac computer (just restart the application)**

NEW
- Added iTunes-Airplay support. Find it in the volume menu of iTunes app
- Add System app that controls vital keyboard buttons and system volume.
- iTunes and Spotify now control app-volume. To change system volume, use the system app.

BUGS
- Fixed bug where the application would crash if an event was sent while looking at the menu.
Initial release

data.description:
SimonRemote allows a Pebble to control iTunes, Spotify, PowerPoint, and Keynote, and the keyboard on a user's Mac computer. It even allows multiple Pebbles to control the same computer...great for parties! 

NOTE: Must install Mac application. Find directions on website linked below.

latest_release.release_notes:
**Make sure to update SimonRemote on your Mac computer (just restart the application)**

NEW
- Added iTunes-Airplay support. Find it in the volume menu of iTunes app
- Add System app that controls vital keyboard buttons and system volume.
- iTunes and Spotify now control app-volume. To change system volume, use the system app.

BUGS

data.description:
A map that rotates, tilts, and zooms.

Up and down buttons zoom in and out.  Pressing up or down continuously pans the map forwards or backwards.  The middle button shows the custom settings, and a long middle press resets the map to your current location.

Customizable features include mapping service, displaying the time, compass, battery, bluetooth, screen inversion, vibration, map labels, and more.

latest_release.release_notes: 2.6 Firmware 4.0 icons

data.author: Christopher 'PeriVision' Peri

changelog.release_notes: Change URL to a cached call.

This is beta 1 using pebble.js  The app takes a list of twitter news feeds, removes duplicates, then displays on the watch.
Still to do:  test on iOS
Known issue:  Sometimes the next story can take a few seconds to display after clicking the button.  This could be a .js issue.

data.description: Read popular twitter news feeds, remove duplicate stories and display on the watch.  Simple eh?  Because this is using Beta .js code, clicking 'select' to get the next story can be delayed by a few seconds.  This has not been tested on iOS.

latest_release.release_notes: Change URL to a cached call.

Introducing PebbMorse, an app to learn and use Morse Code.
Ever wanted to learn Morse Code? This app will give you a new learning experience that won't be only visual, you will actually feel the morse code right on your wrist.

- Time
- Weather
- Learning
- More coming soon

data.description:
There is only one metric for code quality. WTF per minute. Start the timer, read the code, press the counter button on every curse you yell. The app calculates the WTF/Minute for you.
The lesser the number, the better the code. Let's hope for 0 WTF/Minute.

latest_release.release_notes: Initial Release. Let's call it the MVP.

data.author: Pedro

changelog.release_notes: Vuelve a ser compatible con el Pebble original.

Cambios en versin 2.0:

- Esta versin slo funciona en Android (estoy trabajando en hacerla compatible con IOS). 
- Muchsimo ms rpida. Permite buscar en varias lneas a la vez.
- Cambios en la interfaz.
1.63: Corregido bug con nmero de paradas.
1.62.: Ms errores corregidos. Prometo que al final acabar con todos.
1.61: Correccin de errores. Cogiendo carrerilla para la versin 1.7.
1.6.: Gran optimizacin del JS. Ahora carga como 15 segundos ms rpido y en principio tolera mejor los errores. Si alguien encuentra algn bug, que me lo haga llegar, por favor.

Nueva versin completamente remodelada. Se ha cambiado el funcionamiento de la base de datos para ahorrar memoria y ganar velocidad. Adems, ahora no es necesario especificar la lnea; el nuevo sistema tarda unos segundos ms en buscar, pero da mucha ms informacin. 
Tambin he aadido un nuevo modo automtico de bsqueda de parada. Funciona usando el GPS del mvil y muestra en pantalla la parada ms cercana.

1.3: Versin interna para pruebas. 

1.4: Versin definitiva para distribuir. Ahora muestra el nombre de todas las paradas y las lneas que pasan por cada parada. Tambin se ha mejorado el archivo JS que comunica con la web de paradas; de esta forma ahora puedo filtrar mejor los resultados.

Versin 1.2: Se ajusta el archivo JS para que vuelva a funcionar tras los cambios en la web de los autobuses. Se modifica ligeramente la fuente y se aade una vibracin tras recibir los datos de la parada.
Versin 1.1: Ahora los favoritos cargan directamente la solicitud de informacin. Es lo que en principio deberan haber hecho, pero se me olvid introducir el cambio.
Primera versin. Se utiliza Menu layer para las capas dinmicas y se corrigen todos los fallos encontrados en la beta.

data.description:
Programa para conocer el tiempo que tardan en llegar a las paradas los autobuses de Elche. Permite guardar paradas favoritas manteniendo el botn de seleccin pulsado durante ms de 3 segundos.
Agita para obtener los tiempos actualizados.

latest_release.release_notes: Vuelve a ser compatible con el Pebble original.

data.title: Bus Elche

changelog.release_notes: Menu icon
SDK update, potential PT2 and P2 support
SDK Fix
Black and White Pebbles are supported again!
Round support
First color version
SDK update
Visual and battery life improvements

- New How to play screen with valuable tips and tricks
- Slightly modified difficulty and economy
- You can close the race results screen with the select button as well as the back button
- Buildings don't pass you that fast until you get a really fast car

data.description: It's not easy to create a good game for Pebble that's actually easy to control. Just a very few made this right. But there is a popular game genre that ought to be comfortable and fun to play on your wrist! Three buttons are just about right for this kind of game. Also, there's a zero BS factor. No waiting for gas, no double currency. Just a fair game designed to be fun!

latest_release.release_notes: Menu icon

data.title: Drag Racing

data.author: ZeroUptime

changelog.release_notes: Updates the app icon and the internally stored SafeTrack schedule, and fixes a couple minor bugs.
Preview the SafeTrack rebuilding chaos right from your watch! See upcoming & ongoing SafeTrack advisories in the Advisories menu and on station info cards.
Finally! Pebble Time Round support!
No more insta-crashing when opening the app. (Thank you everyone who reported this issue, I truly appreciate it!)

Middle button to refresh bus/train list is back (wrist flick to refresh will still work)! Made the Green Line icon more "green", too. Also, nearly all of the underlying code has been refactored or rearranged to allow future updates to be easier.
A ton of new features! Metrobus support (thanks dschep!), saved stations & bus stops, and a settings page. Also behind-the-scenes performance improvements.
Now in color!
Holding the middle button on a station (rather than just pressing it) will now show a card showing that station's lines, address, today's opening time, and the time of tonight's last train
Improved responsiveness when location isn't available; switched to HTTPS for all data requests
Advisories are now displayed in a list, rather than one long piece of text

data.description:
Washington, D.C. Metrobus & Metrorail schedules on your wrist! View incoming buses and trains for stations and stops near your location, and check network advisories so you're not stuck waiting during single-tracking on the Red Line.

Now with NextBus support too, plus saved stations & bus stops!

latest_release.release_notes: Updates the app icon and the internally stored SafeTrack schedule, and fixes a couple minor bugs.

data.title: WMATA With You

data.author: Robert Kinsella

changelog.release_notes:
Added colour for Pebble Time, 
Added a workout countdown timer option,
Updated timer screen layout
Added options to set a default time/round limit for new workouts
Small bugfix from previous update where setting up a new timer before starting it would affect an existing timer

- Fixed issue where the app may crash if viewing an existing timer and then starting a new one
- Fixed issue where the menu would not update until exiting the app on the run of a timer on a fresh install
Faster increment/decrement of round and time limits on long press when starting a new workout
First release!

data.description:
Update June 2015: Color for Pebble Time | New workout countdown timer option | Updated timer screen layout

Use your Pebble watch to keep a simple track of your timed workout / WOD rounds or sets.

During the workout, use the app to take away the need to remember rounds, allowing you to focus on performing and counting the exercise repetitions.

Select the type of workout from a time or round limited workout, set the limit and begin!

latest_release.release_notes:
Added colour for Pebble Time, 
Added a workout countdown timer option,
Updated timer screen layout

data.title: Workout Rounds

data.description:
Pebble app for connecting to NexaHome (Tellstick) server.

Control your ligths and wallsockets from you watch.

Long press on middle button will cycle dimmers 25% at a time.
See github for use of buttons and configuration.


Important requirement for NexaHome:
In bshfilter.xml use the following setting in order to control devices from Pebble:
<filter>
<allow>*</allow>
</filter>

data.description: Simple and intuitive rest interval timer. Particularly useful for timing rests in the gym, with configurable presets, vibrate on done and an overrun counter. The main menu buttons also work on the countdown screen making it super easy to reset your rest interval.

latest_release.release_notes:
Rebuilt for BASALT, with colour support for Pebble Time. 

- Green = you've got time left
- Red = you're outta time, get lifting

Note that the inverted theme is not currently supported (as yet - I'm looking for a solution for this still).

data.title: Rest

data.author: Sheldon Smith

changelog.release_notes: Updated to allow for Pebble Time Round

data.description:
A game clock and 25-second play clock that can be controlled independently. 

New: Game clock defaults to 12 minutes but can be adjusted to any value and will be saved in memory. 

Instructions
**************
UP BUTTON: Start 25s play clock/Reset play clock
LONG PRESS UP: Start 40s play clock

DOWN BUTTON: Start/Stop game clock

SELECT BUTTON (Long Press):
Enters setting mode.  If game clock is in the middle of a countdown, up and down buttons adjust the game clock.  Single click the select button again to exit the settings mode.  Long click to reset the game clock to the original value.

If game clock is already reset, long pressing the select button will enter a special mode to adjust the game clock's value.  For example, if you change the game clock from 12 minutes to 10 minutes, the clock will automatically reset to 10 minutes in the future.

The current mode of the clock is displayed in the top left corner of the screen.
data.title: Referee Timer (25/40 play clock)

data.description:
The ID Stopwatch app is similar to Big Stopwatch with an identification alert feature.

Your name and an emergency message are entered in the settings screen.  If your stopwatch is running and no activity is registered for several minutes, an alert is displayed with flashing and vibration alerts.

BACK button clears the alert, and long-press the SELECT button to test.  App idea by Greg East.

data.description:
BiteBook is a simple fish logging application. When you're out on a boat, getting your phone out of it's waterproof case to open a fish logging app with a million options is the worst. Who wants to go through that?

BiteBook solves this by logging only the species, location, and dimensions of your catch; with a Pebble integration your phone can stay stored in a safe and waterproof place.

A running app that provides users with timers for each workout of the C25K and B210K running programs.

A buzz will alert you about the end of a running or walking interval and you will also be able to pause or switch the current interval.

The app also allows you to tell the watch to vibrate at an interval of your choice (e.g. 5 minutes) - useful for running, meditating, and cooking steaks.

Use this App to record your Fairway Hits to know you're Golf is improving.

SELECT = Fairway Hit
DOWN = Miss right
Long press UP/DOWN/SELECT= "undo" shot

Vibrates once you have reached 14 shots as that's considered the number of drives on a normal course.

data.author: Chris Lewis

changelog.release_notes:
v4.8:
- Sync in one message
- Hopefully fix long sync time on Pebble 2
- Add link to source code in Android app

v4.6:
- Dismiss full charge notification on unplug.
- Fix a minor layout bug.

v4.5:
- Built with SDK 4.0. In FW 4.0, the launcher entry will now show upcoming scheduled events. This is the only information that really makes sense to show here without an Android AppGlance API.
- Improve the app icon.

v4.3:
- Added option to choose a notification sound for the Find Phone function. Free choice of file may take more time, but this is good for now.
- Added option to post an Android notification when the phone has fully charged. Keep Dashboard enabled in the 'Notifications' section of the Pebble app to receive this.
- Enabled repeating button clicks for scrolling through the toggle grid by holding the button down.
- Fixed notification icon being white circle for Dashboard notifications.

v4.2:
- Unified old and new designs: the icons are back, and centre stage! Use the Up button to view phone status, and the Select button from there to manage Events.

v4.1: 
- Only use ActionMenu when there is more than one action.
- Fix bug with options card not appearing on some devices.
- Fix logic responsible for calculating free space.
- Fix a couple more state/drawing bugs.

v4.0:
- New watchapp design!
- Ability to jump straight to a toggle upon launch.
- Displays GSM network signal strength.
- Displays Wifi network name.
- Displays free storage on phone.
- Re-syncs every 30 seconds while the watchapp is open.
- Repeating clicks enabled in the schedule number window.
- Improved communication protocol.

v3.2:
- Align PBW versions with Android app.

v3.0
- ALL USERS MUST UPDATE ANDROID APP!
- New design for Pebble Time/Steel/Round
- Redesign for Pebble/Pebble Steel
- Fixes bug with Aplite battery display
v1.20: Fix for apparent issue with sync on 3.6.

v1.19:
- ENSURE YOU ALSO HAVE THE ANDROID APP UPDATE!
- Compatibility update for Pebble Time.

v1.17:
- Fix a bug scheduling an auto-brightness event.
- Fix a bug causing the Find Phone service to get stuck in a null STOP state.

v1.16:
- Added Auto Brightness toggle.
- Added toggle for managing the Device Admin status of the Android app. This must be disabled before the app can be uninstalled.
- Fixed bug causing prompt for root access on Android 4.4 and below.
- Fixed bug preventing prompt for Device Admin access on first install.
- Removed spammy live updating of layout. Restart watchapp to apply.
- Improved connection reliability on some devices.
- Improved debug logging.

v1.15:
- Fix a crash for users upgrading with modified toggle layout.
- Fix a bug from v1.14 when the Wakeup List would always show status as OFF.

v1.13
- As of Lollipop, Data toggle requires root.
- Improved Material layout design.
- Ringers fixed on Lollipop: Loud is now All and Silent is now Priority.
- Improved log output in case of error.
- Wakeups needed to be wiped, so be sure to add them again.

v1.10
- New Android app landing activity.
- Changed install flow to reduce confusion.

1.9:
- Bug fixes

1.8:
- Added ability to schedule toggle events by long-pressing SELECT.
- Improved layout drawing.

data.description:
This watchapp lets you control:
- Wi-Fi
- Network Data
- Bluetooth
- Phone Ringer
- AutoSync
- Wi-Fi Access Point
- 'Find phone' sound
- Lock Screen

and also shows you:
- GSM network name
- GSM network strength
- Wifi network name
- Phone battery level
- Phone free space

latest_release.release_notes:
v4.8:
- Sync in one message
- Hopefully fix long sync time on Pebble 2
- Add link to source code in Android app

Version 1.1

data.author: Katharine Berry

changelog.release_notes: Updated schedule (finally!)

- Updated schedule (using unofficial data due to Caltrain's failure to provide appropriate data)

Thanks to Doug Freed!
- Fixed a crash when running on a Pebble Classic or Pebble Steel running firmware 3.8
- Added support for Pebble Time Round.
Fixed a crash on Pebble Time devices running 3.0-dp7 or later. Note that this breaks menu selection on Pebble Time devices running 3.0-dp6 or earlier.
Added Pebble Time support.

- Add two missing trains (Caltrain is bad at schedules)
- Fix potential crash at San Jose
- Removed old schedule and reduced app size

- Updated Caltrain schedule again. Apparently Caltrain is bad at schedules.
- Resolved an issue causing the wrong station to automatically open
- Minor bug fixes

New features!

- Flipped north and south on the stop info screen; north is now on top.
- You can see more trains: press up to see future northbound trains, and down to see future southbound trains
- From the list of trains you can press select to see where and when that particular train will stop
Updated to include new schedule effective October 5th.
Added an icon!
Initial release.

data.description: Shows the next trains to any given Caltrain stop. No phone or internet required; the schedule is stored locally. If a phone is connected, will automatically open the nearest station; otherwise stays in the state you left it in. Now supports Pebble Time!

latest_release.release_notes: Updated schedule (finally!)

changelog.release_notes: Corrected bug with counter on tack tracking.
Corrected bug in management of tack tracking to prevent other commands from repeating under race conditions; removed memory leaks in watchapp which appear to have been causing watch crashes.
JS efficiency improvements and divide by zero checking; c code changes to show graphic more consistently
Improved use of the position field when far from a saved line.
Uses "working" semaphore to discard GPS reports coming in too fast to handle; adds time of day to watch and changes watch heartbeat to reflect incoming data from the phone.
UI tweaks regarding line distance and line heading display
Corrected web page return variables
Corrected errors and refined the pebble - JavaScript interface.
Removed degree symbol from headings because it did not display properly on Droid 4 and perhaps other Android devices.

data.author: Arad Reed

changelog.release_notes: Initial Release

data.description: Up Down is a simple game that randomly picks a direction, up or down. You must push the corresponding button within the time interval or you lose. If you press the wrong button, you'll lose as well. The game gets faster as you progress, and the time interval resets to a lower initial time every 50 points.

latest_release.release_notes: Initial Release

data.title: Up Down

data.author: Vishwa
data.description: This watchapp is created as a first aid guidance to a number of problems that may occur. This guidance information is taken from the red cross app. Please read the disclaimer and use only if you agree (last title on watchapp)
data.title: First Aid guidance (info from Red cross app)

data.author: Braci Ltd.
data.description:
Braci Baby Monitor App able to detect any baby crying sounds very accurately. very sensitive app with a smart algorithm that detects your baby's distress by listening to his/her cries with your smart phones's microphone.

Braci App allows parents to stay in connection with their baby.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=joRspwf6z_w
data.title: Braci - Baby Crying Monitor

data.author: Pebble Apps by Strap

changelog.release_notes: More quacking awesome than ever. Various UI fixes.
Initial release

data.description:
Quack is the modern version of passing a note in class. You may not know who it came from, but you always want to see what it says.

Companion app not required. Now available on the iTunes store and on Pebble! 

400ft. No Sign-in. No History. Just Quacks.

latest_release.release_notes: More quacking awesome than ever. Various UI fixes.

data.title: Quack

data.author: Crispy

changelog.release_notes:
Fixed a bug that prevented the timer from going over 1 hour. Calls can now last 9 hours, 59 minutes, 59 seconds.

I can change this if there is a need. It is done more for conserving RAM on the Pebble.

My first release of this app. If you have any ideas for features or any bugs, please email me. I did it for fun mostly, also because dispatch always messes up our times and I like to keep my own copy.

My first release of this app. If you have any ideas for features or any bugs, please email me. I did it for fun mostly, also because dispatch always messes up our times and I like to keep my own copy.

data.description: This app records times of "En Route", "On Scene", "Pt. Contact" and etc. It also shows elapsed time of the calls. You hit the center button to mark your time and move to the next phase of the call. No more relying on dispatch for times.

latest_release.release_notes:
Fixed a bug that prevented the timer from going over 1 hour. Calls can now last 9 hours, 59 minutes, 59 seconds.

I can change this if there is a need. It is done more for conserving RAM on the Pebble.

data.title: EMS Timer

data.author: TJ Stein

changelog.release_notes: v2.0, complete code update, added RNG, new name, set coin face via app
Fixed a bug where coin graphic would disappear after 3 coin face updates.
When Persistent Storage error occurs, you can now still press any button to continue past the error and still flip. It will just not be able to read what coin you had saved.
Initial Release! Press any button or shake watch to flip coin. Customize coin faces via Settings page.

data.description:
Ever needed a bit of randomness to make a decision? Well then this is the app for you! 

Formerly Coin Flip, this app now has a brand new Random Number Generator in addition to the old coin flipping action. Between 3 awesome coin faces and pure randomness, what's not to love?

Install today!

Changelog: http://random.tjstein.me/changelog

latest_release.release_notes: v2.0, complete code update, added RNG, new name, set coin face via app

data.title: Random

data.author: Donk Studios
data.description: Follow the cursor moving along a meter at the bottom of the screen. Press when the cursor is in the zone of the black area of the meter. This will allow your character to trigger his rifle to shoot the incoming zombies. Do not let them get to you!
data.title: First of Them

data.author: Nick Giarraputo
data.description: If you work at a grocery store register, you have to have quick and easy access to PLU codes. And what's faster than an alphabetized list on your wrist?
data.title: Easy PLU Codes

data.author: Bob Blauschild
data.description:
Your Pebble generates a random text string made up of the letters D, U, and S, and you're given 5 seconds to memorize the sequence before it disappears.            

Match the sequence with  a series of hand movements before time runs out -- Palm Down = D, Palm UP = U, and Palm Sideways = S.

Easy.  Then the sequence length increases until it's extremely not!!
data.title: Hand Hop

data.author: Keith Blom

changelog.release_notes: Support for color.
Made options available from a button on the watch rather than always having to see them on exit from the app.
Support 99 splits. Display day of month without leading zero.
Abbreviate month
Added day of week to watch display.
Rework time/chrono display for larger fonts. Add color option.
v02.01.01 - Initial public release.

data.description:
Watch and chronometer with 99 split memory. The app state is saved across closing so that you can use your favorite watchface while the chronometer is running.

Use "Options" button to access splits and selecte\able options.

Selectable options:

- When splits memory is full, subsequent splits can either be ignored or replace the oldest.

- The chrono reset button can clear splits or not.

- Display colored text on white or white text on color.

- Color to use for text or background.

latest_release.release_notes: Support for color.

data.title: WatchChrono
